channel.title: ScanX – Global

item.title: India Hasn't Offered Market Access to US Agricultural Products Under Bilateral Trade Agreement
item.description: Top News India Hasn't Offered Market Access to US Agricultural Products Under Bilateral Trade Agreement 43 minutes ago Recent reports indicate that India has not granted market access to US agricultural products under the Bilateral Trade Agreement (BTA). This highlights the ongoing complexity in India-US trade relations, particularly in the sensitive area of agricultural trade. The exclusion of agricultural market access from the BTA suggests that this sector may require separate negotiations or additional agreements to address both nations' concerns.

item.title: Max India Limited Allots 20,000 Equity Shares Under Employee Stock Option Plan
item.description: Max India Limited Allots 20,000 Equity Shares Under Employee Stock Option Plan 41 minutes ago Max India Limited allotted 20,000 equity shares under its ESOP Plan 2020 to eligible employees on December 12, 2025. The allotment increased the company's paid-up capital from ₹52.43 crores to ₹52.45 crores, with total equity shares rising to 5,24,50,362. The company made the disclosure in compliance with SEBI regulations to both stock exchanges.

item.title: Trade Setup: Global Cues and Corporate Actions Shape Market Sentiment
item.description: Trade Setup: Global Cues and Corporate Actions Shape Market Sentiment 3 hours ago GIFT Nifty futures down 0.02% at 26,129.00, indicating a flat to slightly negative opening. US markets closed mixed, with Dow up 1.34% and NASDAQ down 0.24%. Asian markets show positive trends. Crude oil up 0.73%, while gold and silver decline. USD/INR trading at 90.30, up 0.09%. FIIs sold ₹2,020.94 crore, while DIIs bought ₹3,796.07 crore on 11-12-2025. Notable block deals in UFLEX, Yes Bank, and Gallantt Ispat. Key corporate actions include EGMs for several companies and NACL Industries' rights issue.

item.title: Samagra Wealthmax Private Limited Acquires Additional 0.20% Stake in Starteck Finance Limited
item.description: Samagra Wealthmax Private Limited Acquires Additional 0.20% Stake in Starteck Finance Limited 4 minutes ago Samagra Wealthmax Private Limited acquired 20,196 equity shares (0.20%) in Starteck Finance Limited through open market transactions between December 1-10, 2025. The acquisition increased the promoter group's total shareholding from 73.09% to 73.29%. The disclosure was made under SEBI regulations with the company noting it was done by way of abundant caution. Starteck Finance's equity capital remains unchanged at ₹9.91 crores comprising 99,10,330 shares of ₹10 each.
